definition: male/Baron, lowest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/CL:個|个[ge4]
member of the senior ministerial class (old)/scholar (old)/bachelor/honorific/soldier/noncommissioned officer/specialist worker

sentences.english: The cunning thief stole the money out of the man's pocket.
sentences.chinese: 狡滑的小偷從那位男士的口袋裏偷了錢。

sentences.english: Men also receive health education and testing that could save their life.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏男士還接受一些可以救命的健康教育和檢查。

sentences.english: Lipstick on Her Collar? Men Say, ‘O.K.’
sentences.chinese: 她衣領上有脣印？男士說，“沒關係”。

sentences.english: You're looking at a guy who could very well get stood up by a stray cat tonight.
sentences.chinese: 在你面前是一位今晚很可能被流浪貓放鴿子的男士。

sentences.english: Guys shouldn't give flowers too often or too infrequently.
sentences.chinese: 男士送花不應該太頻繁或太稀少。

sentences.english: The exchange of words between the man and woman shows a lot about them.
sentences.chinese: 這位女士和這位男士間的對話表露出許多信息。

sentences.english: In the spirit of gender-equality, a male-only carriage must be introduced.
sentences.chinese: 本着男女平等的精神，必須設立男士專用車廂。

sentences.english: It is my pleacertain to welcoming Mr. Smith to we company.
sentences.chinese: 很高興歡迎史密斯男士到咱們自己搞來。

sentences.english: A man complained about a "constant inexplicable cough".
sentences.chinese: 一個男士抱怨他的持續無故咳嗽。

sentences.english: The company regulates that men should wear a suit and tie in business meeting.
sentences.chinese: 公司規定男士在商業會議上必須穿西裝打領帶。

sentences.english: The banks tend to employ only white middle-class men.
sentences.chinese: 銀行總是隻招聘中產階級的白人男士。

sentences.english: And smoothing an eyebrow with a dampened little finger used by males to denote effeminacy in other males.
sentences.chinese: 用潮溼的小指梳理眉毛，暗諷某男士有女人氣。

sentences.english: Man wanted to work in dynamite factory.
Men for the provision of health care quality in Beijing massage service, look forward to your call.
sentences.chinese: 爲在京素質男士提供保健按摩服務，期待你的來電。

sentences.english: A little man got off the horse's back .
sentences.chinese: 一位小個子的男士跨下馬背。
